appointments.chief_complaint: Multiple health issues: diabetes, hypertension, and lower back pain

clinical_notes.subjective: 73-year-old patient with multiple comorbidities. Reports lower back pain 5/10, constant, worse with standing. Diabetes and hypertension well controlled. No leg pain or numbness. Pain affects daily activities.
clinical_notes.objective: Vital signs: BP 145/90, HR 78, Weight 95kg, BMI 32. Blood glucose 8.2 mmol/L. Heart sounds normal. Lungs clear. Limited lumbar flexion. No neurological deficits.
clinical_notes.assessment: Type 2 diabetes, hypertension, chronic lower back pain
clinical_notes.plan: Continue diabetes and hypertension management. Referral to orthopedist for back pain. Consider imaging if symptoms worsen.

appointments.chief_complaint: Referred for chronic lower back pain

clinical_notes.subjective: Chronic lower back pain for 6 months. Pain 5/10, constant, worse with standing and walking. No leg pain or numbness. Patient has diabetes and hypertension. Pain affects daily activities.
clinical_notes.objective: Limited lumbar flexion. No neurological deficits. No straight leg raise test positive. Muscle tension in lumbar paraspinal muscles. BMI 32.
clinical_notes.assessment: Chronic mechanical lower back pain, likely degenerative
clinical_notes.plan: Order lumbar X-ray and MRI. Consider physiotherapy. Pain management with NSAIDs.

appointments.referral_to: Radiologie am Sendlinger Tor - lumbar imaging

appointments.chief_complaint: Lumbar X-ray and MRI for chronic back pain

clinical_notes.subjective: Imaging for chronic lower back pain in elderly patient with multiple comorbidities.
clinical_notes.objective: Lumbar X-ray shows moderate degenerative changes. MRI shows L4-L5 disc desiccation, mild central canal stenosis, and facet joint arthritis. No disc herniation.
clinical_notes.assessment: Lumbar degenerative disc disease with mild central canal stenosis
clinical_notes.plan: Results sent to orthopedist. No acute findings requiring surgery.

appointments.referral_to: Dr. med. Michael Braun - imaging results

appointments.chief_complaint: Imaging results review and treatment plan

clinical_notes.subjective: Patient reports continued back pain. Awaiting imaging results discussion.
clinical_notes.objective: MRI shows lumbar degenerative disc disease with mild central canal stenosis. No disc herniation. No neurological deficits.
clinical_notes.assessment: Lumbar degenerative disc disease with mild central canal stenosis
clinical_notes.plan: Conservative treatment with physiotherapy and pain management. No surgery needed. Consider epidural steroid injection if symptoms worsen.

appointments.chief_complaint: Initial physiotherapy assessment for lumbar degenerative disc disease

clinical_notes.subjective: Patient reports chronic lower back pain. Has diabetes and hypertension. Motivated for therapy. Pain affects daily activities.
clinical_notes.objective: Lumbar ROM: Flexion 45° (limited), Extension 20° (limited). Core strength weak. Poor posture. Tight hip flexors and hamstrings.
clinical_notes.assessment: Lumbar degenerative disc disease with postural dysfunction and muscle imbalance
clinical_notes.plan: 12-week program: manual therapy, postural correction, core strengthening, flexibility exercises. Sessions 2x/week. Consider patient's comorbidities.

clinical_notes.subjective: Patient reports good improvement with physiotherapy. Back pain reduced to 3/10. Diabetes and hypertension well controlled. Very satisfied with treatment.
clinical_notes.objective: Vital signs: BP 140/85, HR 75, Weight 93kg, BMI 31. Blood glucose 7.8 mmol/L. Heart sounds normal. Lungs clear. Improved lumbar ROM.
clinical_notes.assessment: Type 2 diabetes, hypertension, lumbar degenerative disc disease - all well controlled
clinical_notes.plan: Continue current management. Annual follow-up. Patient doing very well.

scans.indication: Chronic lower back pain in elderly patient. Rule out disc herniation and spinal stenosis.
scans.technique: Multi-sequence MRI of lumbar spine performed without intravenous contrast.
findings: Normal vertebral body height and alignment
L4-L5: Disc desiccation with mild central canal stenosis
L5-S1: Mild disc desiccation, no significant herniation
Facet joint arthritis at L4-L5 and L5-S1
Mild central canal stenosis at L4-L5
scans.impression: Lumbar degenerative disc disease with mild central canal stenosis. No disc herniations. Findings consistent with age-related changes.
scans.recommendation: Conservative treatment appropriate. No surgical intervention needed unless symptoms worsen significantly.

doctor_comments.content: MRI shows lumbar degenerative disc disease with mild central canal stenosis. No disc herniations. Findings are consistent with age-related changes and not requiring surgical intervention. Conservative treatment appropriate for this patient. Consider patient's multiple comorbidities when planning treatment.

Patient presents with lumbar degenerative disc disease and mild central canal stenosis. Given patient's age (73) and multiple comorbidities (diabetes, hypertension), conservative treatment is most appropriate. No surgical intervention needed. Physiotherapy and pain management recommended. This case demonstrates the importance of considering patient's overall health status when planning treatment.

Excellent management of multiple comorbidities. Patient's diabetes and hypertension well controlled. Back pain significantly improved with physiotherapy. This case demonstrates the importance of comprehensive care for elderly patients with multiple conditions. Multidisciplinary approach very successful. Patient highly satisfied with overall care.
